In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

This rifle features a collapsible 4 position stock, ambi safety, and weighs in around 7.5 Lbs. Stock # LE6920SOCOMII. Only 1500 Will Be Available ~ Marked Colt Defense. The Daniel Defense RIS II is an innovative upgrade for the M4A1, M16A4, and MK18 CQB/R. The Daniel Defense Rail Interface System II (DD RIS II) was designed at the request of the United States Special Operations Command (SOCOM) for the SOPMOD II weapons system. SOCOM had a specific requirement for a rail system which would accommodate a M203 40mm grenade launcher and still free float the barrel. Daniel Defense responded with a product, the DD RIS II, that met this requirement without the use of additional parts or special tools. This was accomplished by integrating all of the needed parts to mount the M203 into the rail itself. After years of rigorous testing by Special Forces Operators, Daniel Defense was selected as the Sole Source Provider of the RIS II to SOCOM. Daniel Defense has and is still delivering thousands of units and they are continuing to be fielded by SOCOM.

Franchi 912 Variomax Shotgun 3 1/2 12ga automatic 24" barrel

Gradys Great Outdoors
3440 Clemson Boulevard

We take credit card, check or money orders.
Firearm will not ship until check clears.
We charge $25 for shipping to FFL.
Local pickup is available!



In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

3440 Clemson Boulevard

In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

title: For Sale:  MARLIN MODEL 1894 COWBOY COMPETITION CARBINE
postcontent:
I am the original owner of this rifle. It has seen very little use and been in the safe most of the time. This rifle shows little signs of use and is as close to a new rifle as you will find. Below is a description of the rifle. I do not have the box but do have instruction sheet. Will include soft padded gun case.

For serious Cowboy Action shooting competitors who want a lightning-fast carbine, our 1894 Cowboy Competition is the perfect choice. This model is chambered in 38 Special. It is “factory-tuned” to meet the demands of competitive shooters, and features a 20" octagon barrel for quick sight alignment, and a western-style straight-grip walnut stock. Sights are traditional Marble adjustable semi-buckhorn rear and Marble carbine front. The receiver, bolt, trigger guard plate and lever of the 38 Special are color case-hardened for an authentic 19th Century look. To accommodate tang sight installation, the serial number is located on the left side of the receiver.

Caliber 38 Special*
Capacity 10-shot tubular magazine
Action Lever action with squared finger lever; side ejection; color case hardened receiver, bolt, trigger guard plate and lever; solid top receiver; hammer block safety.
Stock Straight-grip American black walnut; hard rubber butt plate; tough Mar-Shield finish; blued steel fore-end cap.
Barrel Tapered octagon with deep-cut Ballard-type rifling (6 grooves).
Twist Rate 1:16" r.h.
Sights Adjustable Marble semi-buckhorn rear, Marble carbine front sight. Offset hammer spur (right or left hand) for scope use. Serial number is on left side of receiver, instead of tang, allowing custom installation of a tang sight by a competent gunsmith.
Overall Length 37.5"
Weight 6.5 lbs.

Sporterized French MAS 1936.

Original 1936 bolt and receiver.

A rare post-war hunting rifle. Information on the armory is fascinating, and their history can be found online.

Open to all reasonable trades, especially Soviet firearms and Curio & Relics! Thanks!

title: For Sale:  Glock 21 45 ACP Short Frame Gen 3 Pistol
postcontent:
This gun has less than 150 round shot through it. Shoots great and has a nice powerful kick to it. Price includes shipping and other fees associated with selling the firearm. WILL TAKE OFFERS

Specifications are below.



The Glock 21SF has some minor exterior design changes as compared to the Glock 21. The Glock 21 a standard third generation Glock pistol, sports the molded-in finger grooves in the grip frame and a mounting rail on the dust cover for mounting lights or lasers. The Glock 21SF incorporates three changes. The first is the ambidextrous magazine release, the redesigned magazines will function in both designs, but the old magazines don't have the necessary cut out in the front of the magazines to function in the redesigned weaon.The magazine capacity didn't change: you still get 13 rounds of .45ACP in the mag, plus one more in your chamber. The second the size of the grip frame, it is noticeably thinner from the backstrap to the trigger (Short Frame) . The third is the modification of a full MIL-SPEC 1913 Picatinny rail system on the dust cover.

Benelli M2 semi-automatic 12ga shotgun 26" barrel

The Benelli M2 Field is the workhorse of the semi-auto Benelli shotguns, with the speed of a thoroughbred. Light, nimble, but ruggedly built, the M2 12-gauge shotgun and 20-gauge shotgun are built around the ultra-reliable Inertia Driven® bolt mechanism. The Inertia Driven® system allows the M2 to digest nearly any 12 gauge cartridge, from 2-3/4" target loads to the heaviest 3" magnums.

Benelli engineers have also adapted the ComforTech® recoil system for the M2. This revolutionary system reduces felt recoil by up to 48% and cuts muzzle climb by 15%. When combined, this puts the shooter back on target up to 69% faster than with any other comparable semi-automatic shotgun. The M2 is not only faster, but with the new ComforTech® system, it may be the most comfortable shotgun you will ever shoot.

In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

title: For Sale:  Champion and Superior Gun Safes starting at
postcontent:
When is the best time to buy a quality safe? 
ANSWER- 
BEFORE something not-so-good happens to your stuff.

A safe isn't the most enjoyable thing to spend your money on. It might not even register on the fun scale. Having a safe though is a good feeling. I bought my first safe, a Liberty, about 15 years ago when Ray Crosby still owned the company. Picking out the safe was kind of fun, getting it into our house, umm- not so much. Loading it with my firearms and other cool stuff was kind of fun, watching my wife cram everything of hers in too, umm -again, not so much fun. (Just kidding honey xo) The end result though, was very comforting. When your valuables are protected in a quality, fire-rated safe, it really does bring a sense of peace your way. We lived in a decent area but there were still break-ins, vandalism, house fires, and wild fires happening occasionally. The safe brought genuine peace of mind. Before the safe, my firearms and other items were hidden (yeah, right) under the bed, in closets, even behind the curtains. When we left for work, dinner, vacation or whatever, it was just a gamble as to whether they would still be there when we returned. Then we had a baby, then another...peace of mind again-only taken up a notch! A safe is just part of our lives now.
If you don't own a safe, but have been thinking that you should get one, the best time is now-before what you're hoping never happens, happens. 
PARKER'S SAFES AND VAULTS is a family-run, home based business operating under Godly principles. We carry CHAMPION and SUPERIOR brand safes. They are sister companies owned by Ray Crosby. (www.championgunsafes.com and www.superiorgunsafes.com) I could carry a bunch of other brands, and have even been approached by some other companies, but I choose Champion and Superior because of their quality, customer service and warranty. I wouldn't sell you a brand that I don't have faith in or wouldn't own myself. ( I own a Superior)
I also keep my prices very fair. I don't do a lot of sale price specials. You won't have to wonder if you could have saved a few dollars by waiting for a big sale. The prices are already low. I'm not trying to retire after one big sale- I just want to sell a lot of safes! When you buy a safe from PARKER'S then tell your friend and he buys a safe, you've stumbled onto my business model.
PARKER'S SAFES AND VAULTS carries around 30 gun safes in sizes from 17 cubic feet up to 75 cubic feet and WE DELIVER, INSTALL AND SERVICE!
If you'd like to see and talk about some quality safes in person, give me a call and arrange a visit. If you Thanks for having a look,
just have some questions about safes, call, email or text me.
Aaron Parker- owner 
931.842-644FIVE

title: For Sale:  Browning Citori White Lightning 12ga 26" barrel over and under shotgun comes with Browning hard travel case ($300 value)
postcontent:
Browning Citori White Lightning 12ga 26" barrel over and under comes with Browning hard travel case ($300 value) LIKE NEW!!

Receiver - Steel • Silver nitride finish • High-relief engraving
Barrel - Ventilated rib
Action - Single selective trigger • Hammer ejectors • Top-tang barrel selector/safety
Stock - Gloss oil finish Grade II/III Walnut • Lightning-style stock and forearm
Features - Vector Pro™ lengthened forcing cones on 12 and 20 • Three Invector-Plus™ choke tubes on 12 and 20 • Three Standard Invector™
on 28 and .410 • Recoil pad on 12 gauge model • Silver bead front sight

Why "White Lightning?"

The term "left in the white", or simply "white" has been used for decades describing the color of shotgun and rifle parts. "In the white" means that firearm parts were not blued or color case-hardened or colored in any way, but left in the natural, polished color of the metal, such as steel. Often times, the bolt, top lever, slide, ejectors and other parts are left in the natural color of the metal, providing a luxurious contrast to the rest of the shotgun. In this way, the Browning's Citori White Lightning receiver and action offer a fine choice as opposed to "blued" over unders. But don't be afraid that the steel receiver is unprotected: the natural color steel receiver and trigger guard are protected from corrosion by a durable coating process called a "nitrided" finish, offering similar protection to bluing. Just with a uniquely elegant and attractive look.

The Citori White Lightning's round knob or pistol grip allows the shooter to position his hand at the same, solid place for each shot, thus offering better control for fast-flying waterfowl  upland game, sporting clays or trap and skeet. Matching the rounded pistol grip is the forearm. It is nicely rounded and together, they give the name to this over under gun as "Lightning Style," or the Citori White Lightning, a classic style indeed, a timeless style.

title: For Sale:  WWI Steyr M1912 1914 9mm SemiAuto Pistol 97% Bluing Machined Steel!
postcontent: WWI Steyr M1912 1914 9mm SemiAuto Pistol 97% Bluing Machined Steel! Orig Cond (+ one box ammo-45 count). Here is an excellent example of the Steyr M1912 (dated 1914) 9mm semi automatic pistol. This pistol has a non-removable magazine (like the broomhandle mauser) and fires the 9mm Steyr ammunition fed by stripper clips. The condition is excellent with an area of thin shallow rust mottling (tattooing) but only on the left side (see photos). The barrel is immaculate with sharp clean rifling. The face of the breach show very few shells ever were fired. The top of the magazine well and follower are bright and shiny as well the trigger, hammer, and barrel! The wood grips have sharp cut cross hatching and appear as new. Outstanding opportunity to acquire such a fine example! The small letter proofs found on the Steyr-Hahn are the last initial of the person inspecting the part. The most common inspection stamp is the letter "K", the proof of Meister Josef Kogler. This sale includes one box of ammo (count 45-someone shot 5 rounds).

title: For Sale:  Colt Gold Cup National Match
postcontent:
Here's a Colt Gold Cup National Match that remains in excellent original condition. This is a "Pre-Series 70" pistol, made in 1966. The National Match is the competition/target version of the famous 1911/Government Model line. Chambered for the .45 ACP it had some features that were unique at the time. These features included the flat top slide with angled cocking serrations, Elliason adjustable rear sight, specially fitted barrel bushing, NM barrel, conical recoil spring plug, special trigger, etc. This pistol is in excellent overall condition. There are a few light handling marks scattered about, but no rust or pitting. I'd grade the original blue finish at about 95-97%. The original checkered walnut grips feature gold Colt medallions and are in excellent shape without cracks, chips or significant wear. The mechanics are in perfect working order and the bore is excellent. This fine pistol comes in an original National Match box, target and instruction/information sheet. The last of the old style Pre-Series 70 National Match pistols was manufactured in 1970 at serial number 37025-NM. I am asking $2300.00 (OBO), sorry no trades at this time. Thanks. 

(I require a bill of sale, proof of Colorado residency, and proof of age)

Like new!!!!

There are many options on the market today for a low priced bolt-action rifle. But the true test of what an inexpensive rifle should be is not just the price. With its 5R rifled precision barrel, adjustable trigger, Hogue traction panels, Melanite Coated Bolt and Guaranteed MOA Accuracy, there is nothing that can come close to what the T/C Venture offers for under $500. The T/C Venture is also USA Made and backs the famous T/C Liftime Warranty and with 16 available calibers there is no problem finding the gun you are looking for. 3440 Clemson Boulevard
Anderson SC 29621

We take credit card, check or money orders.
Firearm will not ship until check clears.
We charge $25 for shipping to FFL.
Local pickup is available!



In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

title: For Sale/Trade:  1976 GMC Sierra 2500
location: Four Oaks, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
My truck is a 1976 GMC 2500 with 163xxx miles on it, with a 1972 Cadillac 472ci engine in it, matted up to a TH400 Transmission. Truck is a work truck, it has bumps and bruises that tell its history. There is rust in the mounting holes of extended mirrors it used to have on it. The stake bed is in great condidtion, with only one of the wooden posts busted but it still functions. The interior is fair, someone took out the stereo that was installed so there is a hole in the dash.

The bad: There is either a short or just a bad battery, truck can't hold a charge and I often have to jump it. The windshield is cracked on the passenger side, but doesn't affect the drivability. The left side gas tank is not operational, wasn't when I got it, and I have not tried to even look at it, lastly the brake lights don't light up, I replaced the brake light switch hoping it was something simple, but it did not fix it, so I fear its wiring, and I am not touching wiring.

Overall this truck is a great work truck, and does not require inspection, and is cheap on registration. It will tow a house off its foundation and has done everything my family has asked of it, but it is time to part with it, and to get into something more economical. If anything the engine and transmission alone are something to envy about this truck.

Please email me for further information or offering of trade.

REDACTED

http://raleigh.craigslist.org/cto/REDACTED.html

In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

title: For Sale:  Savage Fox model B double barrel side by side
postcontent:
I have for sale a Fox model B made by Savage Arms. The color case hardening on the receiver is in great shape still. The barrels have OK bluing, but great shiny bores. The furniture is in great shape: the forend is perfect, the stock has a couple of stress cracks as shown in the pic, but they are not seperated at all. This is a perfect turkey/field gun, being a 12 gauge and having a full choke in one barrel and modified in the other. 

My research shows circa 1968 dating, since there is no serial number, just a date code. 12 gauge, full and modified chokes.

The gun works well the few times I have fired it since acquiring it from my father. I have an ejector piece that needs to be installed for the auto ejectors to work. Right now you have to pluck the empties out. Also comes with a butt pad that was previously installed. I put a new one on but it is a little short on one end.  Should be simple operation. 

$350 obo

OR

Interested in trades for military rifles, surplus rifles, and maybe handguns (yes I have a permit) I am willing to add cash for the right deal. I am also looking for an AR15 upper: 20" barrel, A2 or A3 style, prefer heavy/bull barrel and/or stainless.

FTF, willing to drive up to an hour depending on the deal, or will ship where legal within NY. ID required and I will provide a bill of sale. 


tekudla AT gmail DOT com
